'''[[Elevated c-reactive protein (cr) SD-203|Inflammatory biomarkers]] (CRP, procalcitonin)'''''

- Non-specific, orientation value only

- Procalcitonin < 0.25 ng/ml makes bacteremia/fungemia unlikely

- No reason to measure them systematically

question.title: Interpreting bio-inflammatory markers during bacteremia/fungemia
question.description: What does a procalcitonin level of less than 0.25 ng/ml indicate?

option_a.title: There is a high likelihood of bacteremia/fungemia
option_a.description: A procalcitonin level of less than 0.25 ng/ml suggests a high risk of infection

option_b.title: No reason to measure them systematically
option_b.description: A procalcitonin level of less than 0.25 ng/ml makes systematic measurement unnecessary

option_c.title: Procalcitonin < 0.25 ng/ml makes bacteremia/fungemia unlikely
option_c.description: A procalcitonin level of less than 0.25 ng/ml indicates a low likelihood of infection

option_d.title: No reason to treat the patient
option_d.description: A procalcitonin level of less than 0.25 ng/ml suggests that treatment is not necessary

correct_option.title: C
correct_option.description: The correct answer is option C
